Thanks heaps. Fast download, and works great if you follow the instructions exactly! Remember - run the keygen with admin privileges and in case you were wondering, the install directory is in your C:Program FilesSony and your shared plugins directory is in C:Program Files (x86)Sony

Thanks and good luck!

Vegas Pro 11 REQUIRES Quicktime 7 to be installed. If you are having a crash at startup right after installing, make sure you have Quicktime 7 installed. Will fix it right up. Found this fix while digging through forums. It worked for me.

Works great.  

You have to remove any other installed version for this to work, though [as with previous releases of SV11].  You can't install this side-by-side with the 32-bit version, for instance.

This version works WAY faster on my system than previous V11 releases.  Lots of small fixes to GPU support et al but the GPU rendering blue or green frames bug is still there.  Two fixes for that: either disable the GPU in the main preferences and rely on CPU only rendering, or only use 8-bit mode in the project preferences.

If you're struggling with the stabilizer plugin, that will also only work in 8-bit mode - you can switch to it, run the stabilizer, then switch back to 32-bit.

Thank you for seeding, Ching Liu.

Also: 

Yes, all versions of Vegas require a version of Quicktime to be installed.  If you don't want Apple's destructive installer pwning your machine, download Quicktime Alternative or Quicktime Lite from free-codecs.org.

For other codecs [such as XVID] ffdshow x64 works quite well and reliably.
